item.title: Dedicated vs Shared Internet
item.description:
By: John Shepler When choosing business internet services, bandwidth is important, but understanding the difference between dedicated and shared connections is crucial. What Does Dedicated Mean? Dedicated bandwidth is exclusively for your use. This might seem obvious, but the recent rise of shared bandwidth makes it worth clarifying. The cost-effectiveness of shared bandwidth often makes businesses reconsider their need for a dedicated line. item.title: Data Caps: What They Are and How to Avoid Them
item.description:
By: John Shepler If you’re a frequent internet user, you’ve probably encountered data caps. This article explains these usage limits and how to navigate them. OK, What IS a Data Cap? A data cap restricts the amount of data transferred over a connection within a specific timeframe. Usually set monthly, these limits, measured in MB or GB, reset every 30 days.
